intro: Calamaria pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf calamary, is a small, flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its delicate appearance and historical use in herbal medicine, it is often cultivated in gardens for ornamental purposes.
